trans-unit.source: Defines the abstract methods and events that are required to implement a plug-in document output serializer.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter"></xref> class.

Instances of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter> should be created by using the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerProvider.CreateSerializerWriter%2A> method of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerProvider> object, not the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.ISerializerFactory.CreateSerializerWriter%2A> method of an <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.ISerializerFactory> object.
When overridden in a derived class, cancels an asynchronous write operation.

When overridden in a derived class, returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator"></xref> that writes collated <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> elements.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator"></xref> that writes collated <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> elements to the document output serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.

When overridden in a derived class, returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator"></xref> that writes collated <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> elements together with the given print tickets.
`documentSequencePT` or `documentPT` can be `null` if there are no preferred print settings.
This method does not validate or modify the given print tickets for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If needed, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>-specific <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is valid for a given printer.
The default print preferences for <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence"></xref> content.
The default print preferences for <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref> content.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator"></xref> that writes collated <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> elements to the document output serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.

When overridden in a derived class, synchronously writes a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> element together with an associated <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
`printTicket` can be `null` if there are no preferred print settings.
This method does not validate or modify the given `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If needed, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>-specific <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is valid for a given printer.

The output <xref:System.IO.Stream> of the write operation is normally specified as a parameter to the constructor of the derived class that implements <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> element to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
The default print preferences for the visual element.

When overridden in a derived class, synchronously writes a given <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> together with an associated <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
`printTicket` can be `null` if there are no preferred print settings.
This method does not validate or modify the given `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If needed, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>-specific <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is valid for a given printer.

The output <xref:System.IO.Stream> of the write operation is normally specified as a parameter to the constructor of the derived class that implements <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter>.
The page to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
The default print preferences for the fixedPage content.

When overridden in a derived class, synchronously writes a given <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref> together with an associated <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
`printTicket` can be `null` if there are no preferred print settings.
This method does not validate or modify the given `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If needed, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>-specific <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is valid for a given printer.

The output <xref:System.IO.Stream> of the write operation is normally specified as a parameter to the constructor of the derived class that implements <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter>.
The document to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
The default print preferences for the fixedDocument content.

When overridden in a derived class, synchronously writes paginated content together with an associated <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
`printTicket` can be `null` if there are no preferred print settings.
This method does not validate or modify the given `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If needed, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>-specific <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is valid for a given printer.

The output <xref:System.IO.Stream> of the write operation is normally specified as a parameter to the constructor of the derived class that implements <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter>.
The document paginator that defines the content to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
The default print preferences for the documentPaginator content.

When overridden in a derived class, synchronously writes a given <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence"></xref> together with an associated <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
`printTicket` can be `null` if there are no preferred print settings.
This method does not validate or modify the given `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If needed, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>-specific <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is valid for a given printer.

The output <xref:System.IO.Stream> of the write operation is normally specified as a parameter to the constructor of the derived class that implements <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter>.
The document sequence that defines the content to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
The default print preferences for the fixedDocumentSequence content.
When overridden in a derived class, synchronously writes a given <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.

The output <xref:System.IO.Stream> of the write operation is normally specified as a parameter to the constructor of the derived class that implements <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter>.
The page to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, synchronously writes a given <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence"></xref> to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.

The output <xref:System.IO.Stream> of the write operation is normally specified as a parameter to the constructor of the derived class that implements <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter>.
The document sequence that defines the content to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, synchronously writes a given <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref> to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.

The output <xref:System.IO.Stream> of the write operation is normally specified as a parameter to the constructor of the derived class that implements <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter>.
The document to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.

When overridden in a derived class, synchronously writes the content of a given <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator"></xref> to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.

The output <xref:System.IO.Stream> of the write operation is normally specified as a parameter to the constructor of the derived class that implements <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter>.
The document paginator that defines the content to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, synchronously writes a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> element to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.

The output <xref:System.IO.Stream> of the write operation is normally specified as a parameter to the constructor of the derived class that implements <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> element to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, asynchronously writes a given <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.

`userState` is passed to the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingCompletedEventHandler> when the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.WritingCompleted> event occurs.

The output <xref:System.IO.Stream> of the write operation is normally specified as a parameter to the constructor of the derived class that implements <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter>.
The page to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
A caller-specified object to identify the asynchronous write operation.

When overridden in a derived class, asynchronously writes a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> element together with an associated <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> and identifier to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
`printTicket` can be `null` if there are no preferred print settings.
This method does not validate or modify the given `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If needed, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>-specific <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is valid for a given printer.

`userState` is passed to the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingCompletedEventHandler> when the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.WritingCompleted> event occurs.

The output <xref:System.IO.Stream> of the write operation is normally specified as a parameter to the constructor of the derived class that implements <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter>.

`userState` is passed to the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingCompletedEventHandler> when the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.WritingCompleted> event occurs.

The output <xref:System.IO.Stream> of the write operation is normally specified as a parameter to the constructor of the derived class that implements <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter>.
The document sequence that defines the content to write to the serialization <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
A caller-specified object to identify the asynchronous write operation.
When overridden in a derived class, occurs when a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.CancelAsync"></xref> operation is performed.
When overridden in a derived class, occurs when a write operation finishes.

When overridden in a derived class, occurs just before a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> is added to a stream by a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.Write*"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.WriteAsync*"></xref> method.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.WritingPrintTicketRequired> event enables the event handler to substitute a new <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> for the one specified in the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.Write%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.WriteAsync%2A> method call.
When overridden in a derived class, occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter"></xref> updates its progress.
For example, the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter> could update its progress after every page or after every document in a multi-document write operation.
